meanings.definition: Unable to be avoided or ignored.
meanings.sent1: The storm was unescapable, forcing everyone indoors.
meanings.sent2: The consequences of his actions were unescapable.
meanings.sent3: The unescapable truth finally caught up with him.
meanings.sent4: The unescapable reality of the situation hit her hard.
meanings.sent5: The unescapable deadline loomed over them like a dark cloud.

meanings.sent1: The unescapable outcome was clear from the start.
meanings.sent2: His victory in the game was unescapable.
meanings.sent3: The unescapable fate of the character made the story more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The unescapable truth slowly dawned on him.
meanings.sent5: The unescapable march of time waits for no one.
